tr.td: learn-more-intro

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: #F7F7F7; border: 1px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px

tr.td:
Learn More. What Tests Are Used to Screen for Prostate Cancer?

Screening for prostate cancer is a blood test called the prostate-specific antigen or PSA test. A high PSA level can be a sign of prostate cancer. However, other things like an enlarged prostate or swelling of the prostate also cause a high PSA level. A biopsy of the prostate is necessary to make the diagnosis of cancer.

text.value:
What Tests Are Used to Screen for Prostate Cancer?

Screening for prostate cancer is a blood test called the prostate-specific antigen or PSA test. A high PSA level can be a sign of prostate cancer. However, other things like an enlarged prostate or swelling of the prostate also cause a high PSA level. A biopsy of the prostate is necessary to make the diagnosis of cancer.

Watch a 3-minute video about the PSA testing. We’d like to suggest you watch the video to help you prepare for your upcoming visit. This video can help you prepare to ask questions that are important to you when you visit with your provider.

The website linked below provides some information from the U.S. Preventive Services Task Force (USPSTF) about the benefits and harms of prostate cancer screening. This information can help you prepare to ask questions that are important to you when you visit with your provider.
